paper.title: Equivalence, query-reachability and satisfiability in Datalog extensions
paper.venue: Symposium on Principles of Database Systems
paper.abstract: We consider the problems of equivalence, satisfiability and query-reachability for datalog programs with negation and dense-order constraints. These problems are important for optimizing datalog programs. We show that both query-reachability and satisfiability are decidable for programs with stratified negation provided that negation is applied only to EDB predicates or that all EDB predicates are unary. In the latter case, we show that equivalence is also decidable. The algorithms we present are also used to push constraints from a given query to the EDB predicates.
